revised_title: The Illumination of Lines of Molecular Pressure and the Trajectory of Molecules
tldr: The author, William Crookes, conducted experiments with rarefied gases and the induction current. He discovered a constant dark space surrounding the negative pole, which he called the "molecular disturbance." This phenomenon increased in thickness as the gas was rarefied. Crookes also observed similar effects with different gases and heating the metal pole. His findings suggest that the molecular disturbance is related to the concept of molecular pressure or stress.
